Title: Banana Nut Muffins
Ingredients: ½ cup unsalted butter, melted and cooled slightly
⅔ cup light brown sugar, lightly packed
2 cups mashed very ripe bananas (about 3-4 bananas)
½ cup chopped nuts (walnuts, macadamia nuts, pecans or hazelnuts)
Directions: 2. In a large bowl, whisk melted butter and brown sugar until well combined, about 1 full minute.
3. Add eggs, mashed banana and vanilla, whisking until combined.
4. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.
5. Add dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and use a rubber spatula to lightly stir the batter until almost combined.
6. Add ½ cup nuts and stir until no streaks of flour remain. Be careful not to over-mix.
7. Grease 15 standard-sized muffin cups and divide the batter evenly among the cups.
8. Sprinkle the top of each cup with brown sugar and chopped nuts (topping).
9. Bake for 18-25 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Place the pan on a wire rack to cool.
